official-title.#text:
To designate certain lands in the State of Colorado as components of the National Wilderness
			 Preservation System, to designate the Tenmile Recreation Management Area
			 and Porcupine Gulch Protection Area, and for other purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2(a) of the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993

text.#text:
Congress does not intend that the designation by this Act of Federal lands as wilderness in the
			 State of Colorado creates or implies the creation of protective perimeters
			 or buffer zones around any wilderness area. The fact that nonwilderness
			 activities or uses can be seen or heard from within a wilderness area
			 shall not, of itself, preclude such activities or uses up to the boundary
			 of the wilderness area.

header.#text: Tenmile Recreation Management Area, White River National Forest, Colorado

quote.#tail: (in this section referred to as the

text.#text:
Certain Federal land in the White River National Forest in the State of Colorado which comprise
			 approximately 11,417 acres, as generally depicted as

The purposes of the Recreation Management Area are to conserve, protect, and enhance for the
			 benefit and enjoyment of present and future generations the recreational,
			 scenic, watershed, habitat, and ecological resources of the area.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall manage the Recreation Management Area—

text.#text: The
in a manner that conserves, protects, and enhances—
the purposes of the Recreation Management Area described in subsection (b); and

recreation opportunities, including mountain biking, hiking, fishing, horseback riding,
			 snowshoeing, climbing, skiing, camping, and hunting; and
in accordance with—
the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974

text.#text: any other applicable laws (including regulations); and
this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall only allow such uses of the Recreation Management Area that the
determines would further the purposes described in subsection (b).

text.#text: The

Except as provided in clause (iii), the use of motorized vehicles in the Recreation Management Area
			 shall be limited to those roads, vehicle classes, and periods of use
			 authorized for such use on the date of enactment of this Act.

Except as provided in clause (iii), no new or temporary roads shall be constructed within the
			 Recreation Management Area.

rerouting or closing an existing road or trail to protect natural resources from degradation, as
			 determined to be appropriate by the
authorizing the use of motorized vehicles for administrative purposes;

			 post-fire watershed protection projects;

authorizing the use of motorized vehicles to carry out activities associated subsection (g), (h),
			 or (i); and
responding to an emergency.

all forms of entry, appropriation, and disposal under the public land laws;
location, entry, and patent under the mining laws; and
operation of the mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.

Any land or interest in land that is acquired by the United States within the boundaries of the
			 Recreation Management Area shall—

be managed in accordance with the applicable provisions of this Act and any other applicable laws.

text.#text: The

Nothing in this section affects the construction, repair, reconstruction, replacement, operation,
			 maintenance, or renovation of water management infrastructure existing on
			 the date of enactment of this Act or such future infrastructure necessary
			 for the development or exercise of water rights decreed prior to the date
			 of enactment of this Act within the Tenmile Recreation Management Area.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(e) of the James Peak Wilderness and Protection Area Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: James Peak Wilderness and Protection Area Act/s:3/ss:e

text.#text:
Nothing in this section shall restrict, preclude or otherwise affect the use by the Colorado Army
			 National Guard, a reserve component of the Armed Forces, of the Recreation
			 Management Area for aircraft training, testing, evaluation, emergency
			 response, or other related air operations—

in the manner and degree such uses were authorized to occur on the date of the enactment of this
			 Act; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text: as authorized under future agreements between the

Nothing in this section restricts or precludes, or should cause any other Federal regulation to
			 restrict or preclude—
low-level overflights of military aircraft; or

the designation, modification, or creation of new units of special use airspace, or the
			 establishment of military flight training routes.

Nothing in this section affects the jurisdiction or responsibilities of the State of Colorado with
			 respect to fish and wildlife in the State.

The Recreation Management Area shall not create a protective perimeter or buffer zone around the
			 Recreation Management Area.
